publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3896 Aileen Campbell: Historic Discovery by Biggar Archaeology Groupâ€”That the Parliament congratulates Biggar Archaeology Group on its discovery of the oldest human settlement found in Scotland, at Howburn Farm near Elsrickle; notes that the flint tools discovered date to around 12,000 BC or 14,000 years ago and provide evidence of human settlement in Scotland at a time when the North Sea was dry land and humans were travelling from what is now northern Europe; further notes that the general public is being invited to participate in the Big Biggar Dig, starting on 2 May 2009, to carry out further excavations on the site, and wishes the Biggar Archaeology Group every success for the future following this historic development.
S3M-3896 Historic Discovery by Biggar Archaeology Group (lodged on 9 April 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-3896 Historic Discovery by Biggar Archaeology Group (lodged on 9 April 2009) Kenneth Gibson*, Patricia Ferguson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Rob Gibson*, Bob Doris*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Jim Hume*, Gil Paterson*, Christina McKelvie*, Sandra White*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3896 Historic Discovery by Biggar Archaeology Group (lodged on 9 April 2009) Robin Harper*
S3M-3896 Historic Discovery by Biggar Archaeology Group (lodged on 9 April 2009) Karen Gillon*
S3M-3896 Historic Discovery by Biggar Archaeology Group (lodged on 9 April 2009) Stuart McMillan*
